data.title: Meaning of QUEBRA
data.meta_description: Dori Caymmi's song 'Quebra-Mar' is a poetic ode to the natural beauty of the sea and sky, capturing the serene and mesmerizing moments that occur at the...
data.text:
Dori Caymmi's song 'Quebra-Mar' is a poetic ode to the natural beauty of the sea and sky, capturing the serene and mesmerizing moments that occur at the breakwater. The lyrics paint vivid imagery of the moonlight illuminating the sea in the early hours, creating a scene that is both tranquil and awe-inspiring. The moon's light, described as 'embranquecer' (whitening) and 'incandecer' (glowing), transforms the water into a luminous spectacle, blinding the observer with its brilliance. This imagery evokes a sense of peace and wonder, inviting listeners to appreciate the simple yet profound beauty of nature.

The song also highlights the celestial elements, with the 'medalhão da Cruz do Sul' (medallion of the Southern Cross) shining in the velvet blue sky. This reference to the Southern Cross constellation adds a layer of cultural significance, as it is a prominent feature in the southern hemisphere's night sky, symbolizing guidance and navigation. The 'cordão de prata do luar' (silver cord of moonlight) further enhances the ethereal quality of the scene, creating a connection between the heavens and the earth.

As the song progresses, it shifts to the dawn, describing the 'aurora avermelhar o céu' (dawn reddening the sky) and the 'anel de ouro velho do astro-rei' (old gold ring of the sun) rising on the horizon. This transition from night to day signifies renewal and the continuous cycle of nature. The final verses bring attention to the wind stirring the sail of a jangada (a traditional Brazilian fishing boat), set against the 'tela azul do mar' (blue canvas of the sea). This imagery not only celebrates the natural world but also subtly acknowledges the human connection to it, as the jangada represents the livelihood and traditions of coastal communities.

'Quebra-Mar' is a celebration of the natural world's beauty, capturing the interplay of light, water, and sky in a way that is both poetic and deeply evocative. It invites listeners to pause and appreciate the fleeting yet timeless moments of nature's grandeur.
